inline xbrl viewer application relies heavily javascript need allow javascript to use this application inline viewer menu menu information save xbrl instance save xbrl zip file open html setting help section section additional search option include fact name include fact content include label include definition include dimension reference option include topic include sub topic include paragraph include publisher include section match case clear search submit search data data amount text only calculation only negative only additional item only tag tag all standard only custom only filter more filter selecting will take moment period measure axis explicit typed member explicit typed scale balance debit credit reset all filter link fact inline xbrl html form performance may affected using google chrome help alleviate of performance issue loading inline form tagged section search all search in internal section only search in external section only clear section search submit section search help getting started the inline xbrl viewer allows user to quickly easily review detail of the tagged information in inline document automatically placing top and bottom highlight border around tagged numeric fact and left and right border each block tagged fact hovering over tagged fact will highlight shade all content related to the tagged fact and clicking on tagged fact will reveal tagging detail in the fact review window navigation search and filter option also provided to easily refine and identify specific type of tagged information fact review window the fact review window show the tagging detail for the currently selected fact is highlighted solid blue border are four category of fact detail which can be viewed an value indicates there is available information for the item within the given category attribute all primary information applicable describing the tagged fact including period sign decimal dimensional detail ax and member scale measure and data type label detailed documentation definition for the tag used and label reference authoritative reference information applicable for the selected tag calculation balance and calculation hierarchy detail numeric non dimensioned item only searching there are two way to search the document fact and section to search information enter keyword in search box and select the magnifying glass icon to return matching result search operator and via and and or via or or are available to refine search fact the search fact box can be used to find tagged fact matching entered keywords by default tag name tag label and tagged content are included in search tagged fact matching the search criterion are shown with yellow colored default shading on the page and appear in the fact list select the button to the left of the magnifying glass icon to clear the search the content included in search can be increased to included tag definition dimension and authoritative reference by selecting the cog wheel icon to the left of the search box see setting for more information section the search section box can be used to filter the tagged section of the financial statement filter filter change the number of highlighted fact and item in the fact list by providing several way to review and pinpoint certain tagged information multiple filter can be used data filter these filter option allow the user to refine the highlighted tagged fact by data type all display all tagged data default amount only numeric fact only text only textual fact only calculation only numeric fact participating in calculation only negative only negative numeric amount only additional item only tagged fact without corresponding html presentation hidden fact only tag filter these filter allow the user to refine the highlighted fact by tag type all display all tagged data default standard only fact with standard tag common taxonomy us_gaap ifrs dei custom only fact with extension custom tag unique to the entity document more filter additional filter allow user to further refine the highlighted fact period list of all used context year and reporting period measure list of all used unit of measure dollar applicable axis list of all used axis dimension applicable dimension applicable scale list of all used scaled option thousand million applicable balance debit credit applicable multiple filter work in conjunction with each other for example selecting the amount only data filter and custom only tag filter will highlight only numeric tagged fact using custom tag and list in the fact list active filter are displayed in the filter toolbar are selected active filter can be removed individually by unchecking or selecting all option for each filter or all at once via the reset all filter option fact list result on the toolbar select the count to the right of the word fact fact to reveal the fact list result navigable listing of all currently highlighted tagged fact the count represents the current number of fact by default all tagged fact are displayed in the fact list result the list content and count reflects the currently highlighted fact filter and search criterion refine the list to match the highlighted tagged fact navigation control are available to move the list well move the current view to the corresponding highlighted fact location automatically fact in the fact result list is selected will reveal the fact review window certain letter may appear to the right of an item in the fact result list to indicate certain property the letter appears for fact it indicates the fact is additional data hidden with potentially no corresponding html presentation if the letter appears the fact is tagged with custom tag if the letter appears the fact is tagged with dimensional information section the section toolbar item provides listing of the tagged section of the inline document section are divided three group document entity information financial statement note to the financial statement by expanding group and selecting section item in the listing inline xbrl viewer will navigate to that section when the tagged section feature is open the search section box will additionally filter the list of section to only section that match the entered criterion menu information the information menu item provides additional detail the current inline document and customizable viewer setting company and document basic company and document information tag fact and tag standard and custom information file file used additional item additional hidden data that tagged potentially corresponding location in the html save xbrl instance the save xbrl instance menu item allows an xbrl instance document xml that is extracted from the inline document to be saved locally for use by software supporting the xbrl format save xbrl zip the save xbrl zip menu item allows zip file zip that contains the provided xbrl instance document and related custom taxonomy file to be saved locally setting the setting menu item provides the ability to customize viewer feature tagged fact hover on display the hover fact review window for any tagged fact hide the hover fact review window for any tagged fact default may impact performance with certain web browser auto scrolling position this setting will have no effect on ie or safari top selecting fact from the section menu or the fact menu will automatically scroll that element to the top of the inline xbrl viewer window default center selecting fact from the section menu or the fact menu will automatically scroll that element to the middle of the inline xbrl viewer window highlight color use the save and reset button to save the selected setting or reset to default tagged data change the highlight color of the tagged fact border search result change the background color of tagged item matching the search result selected fact change the color of highlight border used to identify the currently selected fact tag shading hover change the color of the shading applied to tagged data on hover search option match case match the specific case of the entered search keyword include label extends search to include tag label include definition extends search to include tag definition include dimension extends search to include dimensional detail include reference extends search to include authoritative reference information optionally specify the reference part to include in the search topic subtopic section help this content version indicates the current build of the inline xbrl viewer application fact any forward looking statement viii table of content index to financial statementspart iitem businesssouthern company is holding company that owns all of the outstanding common stock of three traditional electric operating company southern power company and southern company gas the traditional electric operating company alabama power georgia power and mississippi power are each operating public utility company providing electric service to retail customer in three southeastern state in addition to wholesale customer in the southeast southern power company is also an operating public utility company the term southern power when used herein refers to southern power company and it subsidiary the term southern power company when used herein refers only to the southern power parent company southern power develops construct acquires owns and manages power generation asset including renewable energy and battery energy storage project and sell electricity at market based rate in the wholesale market southern company gas is an energy service holding company whose primary business is the distribution of natural gas in four state illinois georgia virginia and tennessee through the natural gas distribution utility southern company gas is also involved in several other business that are complementary to the distribution of natural gas southern company also owns all of the outstanding common stock or membership interest of sc southern linc southern holding southern nuclear powersecure and other direct and indirect subsidiary sc the system service company ha contracted with southern company each traditional electric operating company southern power southern company gas southern nuclear segco and other subsidiary to furnish at direct or allocated cost and upon request the following service general executive and advisory general and design engineering operation purchasing accounting finance treasury legal tax information technology marketing auditing insurance and pension administration human resource system and procedure digital wireless communication cellular tower space and other service with respect to business and operation construction management and southern company power pool transaction southern linc provides digital wireless communication for use by southern company and it subsidiary company and also market these service to the public and provides fiber optic service through it subsidiary southern telecom inc southern linc system cover approximately square mile in the southeast southern holding is an intermediate holding company subsidiary primarily for southern company leveraged lease and other investment southern nuclear operates and provides service to the southern company system nuclear power plant and is currently managing construction of and developing plant vogtle unit and which are co owned by georgia power powersecure provides energy solution to electric utility and their customer in the area of program emergency operation and other matter affecting the reliability of bulk power supply the traditional electric operating company have joined with other utility in the southeast to form the serc to augment further the reliability and adequacy of bulk power supply through the serc the traditional electric operating company are represented at the north american electric reliability corporation southern company recently joined filing at the ferc proposing southeast energy exchange market seem that includes many of the electric service provider in the southeast seem is an extension of the existing bilateral market participant would use an automated intra hour energy exchange to buy and sell power close to the time the energy is consumed utilizing available unreserved transmission if approved by the ferc seem is expected to begin service in early the ultimate outcome of this matter can not be determined at this time the utility asset of the traditional electric operating company and certain utility asset of southern power company are operated single integrated electric system or southern company power pool pursuant to the iic activity under the iic are administered by sc which act agent for the traditional electric operating company and southern power company the fundamental purpose of the southern company power pool is to provide for the coordinated operation of the electric facility in an effort to achieve the maximum possible economy consistent with the highest practicable reliability of service subject to service requirement and other operating limitation system resource are committed and controlled through the application of centralized economic dispatch under the iic each traditional electric operating company and southern power company retains it lowest cost energy resource for the benefit of it own customer and delivers any excess energy to the southern company power pool for use in serving customer of other traditional electric operating company or southern power company or for sale by the southern company power pool to third party the iic provides for the recovery of specified cost associated with the affiliated operation thereunder well the proportionate sharing of cost and revenue resulting from southern company power pool transaction with third party in connection with the sale of former subsidiary gulf power in january an appendix added to the iic setting forth term and condition governing gulf power continued participation in the iic for defined transition period that subject to certain potential adjustment is scheduled to end on january southern power and southern linc have secured from the traditional electric operating company certain service which are furnished in compliance with ferc regulation alabama southern power in item herein for additional information regarding southern power acquisition disposition construction and development project southern power calculates an investment coverage ratio for it generating asset including those owned with various partner based on the ratio of investment under contract to total investment using the respective generation facility net book value or expected in service value for facility under construction the investment amount with the inclusion of investment associated with the facility currently under construction well other capacity and energy contract southern power average investment coverage ratio at december wa through and through with an average remaining contract duration of approximately year for the year ended december approximately of contracted mws were with aaa to or equivalent rated counterparties were with bbb to bbb or equivalent rated counterparties and were either with unrated entity that have ratemaking authority or those have posted collateral to cover potential credit exposure southern power electricity sale from natural gas generating facility are primarily through long term ppas that consist of two type of agreement the first type referred to unit or block sale is customer purchase from dedicated plant unit where all or portion of the generation from that unit is reserved for that customer southern power typically ha the ability to serve the unit or block sale customer from an alternate resource the second type referred to requirement service provides that southern power serf the customer capacity and energy requirement from combination of the customer own generating unit and from southern power resource not dedicated to serve unit or block sale southern power ha right to purchase power provided by the requirement customer resource when economically viable capacity charge that form part of the ppa payment are designed to recover fixed and variable operation and maintenance cost based on dollar per kilowatt year and to provide return on investment southern power electricity sale from solar and wind renewable generating facility are also primarily through long term ppas however these solar and wind ppas not have capacity charge and customer either purchase the energy output of dedicated renewable facility through an energy charge or provide southern power certain fixed price for the electricity sold to the grid result southern power ability to recover fixed and variable operation and maintenance expense is dependent upon the level of energy generated from these facility which can be impacted by weather condition equipment performance transmission constraint and other factor generally under the renewable generation ppas the purchasing party retains the right to keep or resell the renewable energy credit southern power actively pursues replacement ppas prior to the expiration of it current ppas and anticipates that the revenue attributable to one customer may be replaced by revenue from new customer however the expiration of any of southern power current ppas without the successful remarketing of replacement ppa could have material negative impact on southern power earnings but is not expected to have material impact on southern company earnings southern company gassouthern company gas is an energy service holding company whose primary business is the distribution of natural gas through the natural gas distribution utility southern company gas is also involved in several other business that are complementary to the distribution of natural gas including gas pipeline investment wholesale gas service and gas marketing service southern company gas also ha an all other non reportable segment that includes segment below the quantitative threshold for separate disclosure including storage operation and subsidiary that fall below the quantitative threshold for separate disclosure see note to the financial statement under southern company gas in item herein for information regarding southern company gas disposition during gas distribution operation the largest segment of southern company gas business operates construct and maintains approximately mile of natural gas pipeline and storage facility with total capacity of bcf to provide natural gas to residential commercial and industrial customer gas distribution all of their coal burn requirement these agreement have term ranging between one and three year fuel procurement specification emission allowance environmental control system and fuel change have electric utility industry in the is continuing to evolve result of regulatory and competitive factor the competition for retail energy sale among competing supplier of energy is influenced by various factor including price availability technological advancement service and reliability these factor are in turn affected by among other influence regulatory political and environmental consideration taxation and supply the retail service right of all electric supplier in the state of georgia are regulated by the territorial electric service act of pursuant to standard set forth in this act the georgia psc ha assigned substantially all of the land area in the state to supplier notwithstanding such assignment this act provides that any new customer locating outside of municipal limit and connected load of at least kw may exercise one time choice for the life of the premise to receive electric service from the supplier of it choice pursuant to the utility act the mississippi psc issued grandfather certificate of public convenience and necessity to mississippi power and to six distribution rural cooperative operating in southeastern mississippi served in whole or in part by mississippi power authorizing them to distribute electricity in certain specified geographically described area of the state the six cooperative serve approximately retail customer in certificated area of approximately square mile in area included in grandfather certificate the utility holding such certificate may extend or maintain it electric system subject to certain regulatory approval extension of facility by such utility or extension of facility into that area by other utility may not be made unless the mississippi psc grant cpcn area included in cpcn that are subsequently annexed to municipality may continue to be served by the holder of the cpcn irrespective of whether it ha franchise in the annexing municipality on the other hand the holder of the municipal franchise may not extend service into such newly annexed area without authorization by the mississippi psc generally the traditional electric operating company have experienced and expect to continue to experience competition in their respective retail service territory in varying degree from the development and deployment of alternative energy source such self generation described below and distributed generation technology well other factor southern power competes with investor owned utility ipps and others for wholesale energy sale across various utility market the need of these market are driven compensated in accordance with the provision of the federal power act such compensation to reflect the net investment of the licensee in the project not in excess of the fair value of the property plus reasonable damage to other property of the licensee resulting from the severance therefrom of the property the ferc may grant relicenses subject to certain requirement that could result in additional cost the ultimate outcome of these matter can not be determined at this time nuclear regulationalabama power georgia power and southern nuclear are subject to regulation by the nrc the nrc is responsible for licensing and regulating nuclear facility and material and for conducting research in support of the licensing and regulatory process mandated by the atomic energy act of amended responsibility also include protecting public health and safety protecting the environment protecting and safeguarding nuclear material and nuclear power plant in the interest of national security and environmental law and regulation impacting the registrant rate mattersrate structure and cost recovery planselectricthe rate and service regulation of the traditional electric operating company are uniform for each class of service throughout their respective retail service territory rate for residential electric service are generally of the block type based upon kwhs used and include minimum charge residential and other rate contain separate customer charge rate for commercial service are presently of the block type and for large customer the billing demand is generally used to determine capacity and minimum bill charge these large customer rate are generally based upon usage by the customer and include rate with table of content index to financial statementsspecial feature to encourage off peak usage additionally alabama power and mississippi power are generally allowed by their respective state pscs to negotiate the term and cost of service to large customer such term and cost of service however are subject to final state psc approval the traditional electric operating company recover certain cost through variety of forward looking cost based rate mechanism fuel and net purchased energy cost are recovered through specific fuel cost recovery provision these fuel cost recovery provision are adjusted to reflect increase or decrease in such cost needed or on schedule required by the respective pscs approved compliance storm damage and certain other cost are recovered at alabama power and mississippi power through specific cost recovery mechanism approved by their respective pscs certain similar cost at georgia power are recovered through various base rate tariff approved by the georgia psc cost not recovered through specific cost recovery mechanism are recovered at alabama power and mississippi power through annual formulaic cost recovery proceeding and at georgia power through periodic base rate proceeding see note to the financial statement in item herein for discussion of rate matter and certain cost recovery mechanism also see integrated resource planning herein for additional information the traditional electric operating company and southern power company and certain of it generation subsidiary are authorized by the ferc to sell power to non affiliate including short term opportunity sale at market based price specific ferc approval must be obtained with respect to market based contract with an affiliate mississippi power provides service under long term contract with rural electric cooperative association and municipality located in southeastern mississippi under full requirement cost based electric tariff which are subject to regulation by the ferc the contract with these wholesale customer represented of mississippi power total operating revenue in and are generally subject to year rolling cancellation notice historically these wholesale customer have acted group and any change in contractual relationship for one customer are likely to be followed by the other wholesale customer natural gassouthern company gas natural gas distribution utility are subject to regulation and oversight by their respective state regulatory agency rate charged to customer vary according to customer class residential commercial or industrial and rate jurisdiction these agency approve rate designed to provide the opportunity to generate revenue to recover all prudently incurred cost including return on rate base sufficient to pay interest on debt and provide reasonable roe with the exception of atlanta gas light the earnings of the natural gas distribution utility can be affected by customer consumption pattern that are largely function of weather condition and price level for natural gas the natural gas distribution utility have weather or revenue normalization mechanism that mitigate revenue fluctuation from customer consumption change atlanta gas light operates in deregulated environment in which marketer rather than traditional utility sell natural gas to end use customer and earns revenue by charging rate to it customer based primarily on monthly fixed charge that are set by the georgia psc in addition to natural gas cost recovery mechanism other cost recovery mechanism and regulatory rider which vary by utility allow recovery of certain cost such those related to infrastructure replacement program well environmental remediation energy efficiency plan and bad debt see note to the financial statement under southern company gas in item herein for discussion of psc alabama power construct any new generating facility unless such construction is an ordinary extension of an existing table of content index to financial statementssystem in the usual course of must file an irp with the georgia psc that specifies it intends to meet the future electric service need of it customer through combination of demand side and supply side resource the georgia psc under state law must certify any new demand side or supply side resource for georgia power to receive cost recovery once certified the lesser of actual or certified construction cost and purchased power cost is recoverable through rate certified cost may be excluded from recovery only on the basis of fraud concealment failure to disclose material fact imprudence or criminal misconduct see note nuclear energy financing act and the georgia psc certification of plant vogtle unit and which allow georgia power to recover certain financing cost for construction of plant vogtle unit and mississippi powerin november the mississippi psc established the integrated resource planning and reporting rule irp rule which is intended to allow electric utility the flexibility to formulate long term plan to best meet the need of their customer through combination of demand side and supply side resource and considering transmission need the irp rule establishes reporting requirement that include the triennial filing of an irp with supply side update midway through the three year cycle and an annual report on energy delivery improvement the irp filing is not intended to supplant or replace the mississippi psc existing regulatory process for petition and approval of cpcns for new generating resource mississippi power will file it first triennial irp in compliance with the irp rule in april see note to the financial statement under mississippi power reserve margin plan in item herein for information regarding an order issued by the mississippi psc on december requiring mississippi power to incorporate into it irp schedule of early or anticipated retirement of mws of fossil steam generation by year end to reduce mississippi power excess reserve margin human continually improving it safety technology and process the southern company system safety and health council which includes leader from each registrant work collectively across the southern company system to provide safety leadership share learning work collaboratively to address safety related issue and govern the consistency of safety program the safety program are focused on the prevention and elimination of life altering event serious injury and fatality these program include continuous process improvement to put critical control in place to prevent serious injury promote learning and implement appropriate corrective action in the southern company system had serious injury rate of which represent the number of incident per employee calculated by taking the number of serious injury multiplied by workhours and divided by the total employee workhours during the year serious injury is one that is life threatening or life changing for the employee serious injury example defined by applicable safety regulator include fatality amputation trauma to organ certain bone fracture severe burn and eye injury since the onset of the covid pandemic in early the southern company system ha continued to provide essential service to customer while protecting employee customer and community by implementing applicable business continuity plan including teleworking canceling nonessential business travel increasing cleaning frequency at business location implementing applicable safety and health guideline issued by federal state and local official and establishing protocol for required work on customer premise to date these procedure have been effective in maintaining the southern company system critical operation while also emphasizing employee customer and community safety the regulation change in enforcement practice of regulator or penalty imposed for noncompliance with existing law or regulation could influence the operating environment of southern company and it subsidiary and may result in substantial cost the southern company system cost of compliance with environmental law and satisfying related aros are significant the southern company system operation are regulated by state and federal environmental agency through variety of law and regulation governing air ghgs water land and other natural resource compliance with existing environmental requirement involves significant capital and operating cost including the settlement of aros major portion of which is expected to be recovered through retail and wholesale rate there is no assurance however that all such cost will be recovered the registrant expect future compliance expenditure will continue to be significant the epa ha adopted and is implementing regulation governing air and ghg emission under the clean air act and water quality under the clean water act the epa and certain state have also adopted and continue to propose regulation governing the disposal of ccr including coal ash and gypsum in landfill and surface impoundment at active generating power plant the cost estimate for aros related to the disposal of ccr are based on information using various assumption related to closure and post closure cost timing of future cash outlay inflation and discount rate and the potential compliance method the traditional electric operating company will continue to periodically update their aro cost estimate additionally environmental law and regulation covering the handling and disposal of waste and release of hazardous substance could require the southern company system to incur substantial cost to clean up affected site including certain current and former operating site and location subject to contractual obligation litigation over environmental issue and claim of various type including property damage personal injury and citizen enforcement of environmental requirement ha occurred throughout the this litigation ha included but is not limited to claim for damage alleged to have been caused by and other emission ccr release of regulated substance and alleged exposure to regulated substance and or request for injunctive relief in connection with such matter compliance with any new or revised environmental law or regulation could affect many area of operation for the southern company system the southern company system ultimate environmental with ghg legislation regulation and emission reduction goal could be significant additional ghg policy including legislation may emerge in the future requiring the united state to transition to lower ghg emitting economy however the ultimate impact will depend on various factor such state adoption and implementation of requirement low natural gas price the development deployment and advancement of relevant energy technology the ability to recover cost through existing ratemaking provision and the outcome of pending and or future legal challenge because natural gas is fossil fuel with lower carbon content relative to other fossil fuel future ghg constraint including but not limited to the imposition of carbon tax may create additional demand for natural gas both for production of electricity and direct use in home and business however such demand may be tempered by legislation limiting the use of natural gas in certain situation such new construction future ghg constraint designed to minimize emission from natural gas could likewise result in increased cost to the southern company system and affect the demand for natural gas well the price charged to customer and the competitive position of natural gas southern company ha established an intermediate goal of reduction in carbon emission from level by and long term goal of net zero emission by achievement of these goal is dependent on many factor including natural gas price and the pace and extent of development and deployment of low to no carbon energy technology and negative carbon concept the strategy to achieve these goal also relies on continuing to pursue diverse portfolio including low carbon and carbon free resource and energy efficiency resource continuing research and development with particular focus on technology that lower ghg emission including method of removing carbon from the atmosphere and constructively engaging with policymakers regulator investor customer and other stakeholder to support outcome leading to net zero future see management discussion and analysis future earnings potential environmental matter global climate issue in item herein for additional southern power cost of generation but the cost of purchased power well the robust growth in supply over the last several year ha allowed natural gas price for the most part to remain below per mmbtu supply availability well the cost of natural gas in addition new demand in particular export to mexico and those from lng facility ha grown significantly and is having greater impact on the contracted coal requirement they may be required to purchase their coal requirement at higher price and these increased cost may not be recoverable through rate in addition to fuel supply the interest at variable rate based on libor or other floating benchmark rate the potential phasing of these rate may adversely affect the cost of financing the discontinuation reform or replacement of libor or any other benchmark rate may have an unpredictable impact on contractual relationship in the credit market or cause disruption to the broader financial market and could result in adverse consequence to the return on value of and market for the registrant security and other instrument whose return are linked to any such benchmark failure to comply with debt covenant or condition could adversely affect the ability of the registrant segco southern company gas capital or nicor gas to execute future borrowing the debt and credit agreement of the registrant segco southern company gas capital and nicor gas contain various financial and other covenant georgia power loan guarantee agreement with the doe contains additional covenant event of default and mandatory prepayment event relating to the construction of plant vogtle unit and failure to meet those covenant beyond applicable grace period could result in accelerated due date and or termination of the agreement table of condition of some insurance company actual or threatened physical or cyber attack and natural disaster among other thing could have disruptive effect on insurance market the availability of insurance may decrease and the insurance that the registrant are able to obtain may have higher deductible higher premium and more restrictive policy term further the insurance policy may not cover all of the potential exposure or the actual amount of loss incurred the use of derivative contract by southern company and it subsidiary in the normal course of business could result in financial loss that negatively impact the net income of the registrant or in reported net income volatility southern company and it subsidiary use derivative instrument such swap option future and forward to manage their commodity and interest rate exposure and to lesser extent manage foreign currency exchange rate exposure and engage in limited trading activity the registrant could recognize financial loss result of volatility in the market value of these contract or if counterparty fails to perform these risk are managed through risk management policy limit and procedure which might not work planned and can not entirely eliminate the risk associated with these activity in addition derivative contract entered into for hedging purpose might not offset the underlying exposure being hedged expected resulting in financial loss in the absence of actively quoted market price and pricing information from external source the valuation of these financial instrument can involve management judgment or use of estimate the factor used in the valuation of these instrument become more difficult to predict and the calculation become le reliable further into the future result change in the underlying assumption or use of alternative valuation method could affect the reported fair value of these contract in addition southern company gas utilizes derivative instrument to lock in economic value in wholesale gas service which may not qualify or may not be designated hedge for accounting purpose the difference in accounting treatment for the underlying position and the financial instrument used to hedge the value of the contract can cause volatility in reported net income of southern company and southern company gas while the position are open due to mark to market accounting see note and to the financial statement in item herein for additional information future impairment of goodwill or long lived asset could have material adverse effect on the registrant result of operation goodwill is perpetual use storage assetsgas distribution operationssouthern company gas owns and operates eight underground natural gas storage field in illinois with total working capacity of approximately bcf approximately bcf of which is usually cycled on an annual basis this system is designed to meet about of the estimated peak day delivery and approximately of the normal winter delivery in illinois this level of storage capability provides nicor gas with supply flexibility improves the reliability of delivery and help mitigate the risk associated with seasonal price movement southern company gas financial statement combined management discussion and analysissouthern company and subsidiary company annual reportoverviewbusiness activitiessouthern company is holding company that owns all of the common stock of three traditional electric operating company well southern power and southern company gas and owns other direct and indirect subsidiary the primary business of the southern company system are electricity sale by the traditional electric operating company and southern power and the distribution of natural gas by southern company gas southern company reportable segment are the sale of electricity by the traditional electric operating company the sale of electricity in the competitive wholesale market by southern power and the sale of natural gas and other complementary product and service by southern company gas see note to the financial statement for additional information the traditional electric operating company alabama power georgia power and mississippi power are vertically integrated utility providing electric service to retail customer in three southeastern state in addition to wholesale customer in the southeast southern power develops construct acquires owns and manages power generation asset including renewable energy and battery energy storage project and sell electricity at market based rate in the wholesale market southern power continually seek opportunity to execute it strategy to create value through various transaction including acquisition disposition and sale of partnership interest development and construction of new generating facility and entry into ppas primarily with investor owned utility ipps municipality electric cooperative and other load serving entity well commercial and industrial customer in general southern power commits to the construction or acquisition of new generating capacity only after entering into or assuming long term ppas for the new facility southern company gas is an energy service holding company whose primary business is the distribution of natural gas southern company gas owns natural gas distribution utility in four state illinois georgia virginia and tennessee and is also involved in several other complementary business southern company gas manages it business through four reportable segment gas distribution operation gas pipeline investment wholesale gas service which includes sequent natural gas asset optimization company and gas marketing service which includes southstar marketer and provider of energy related product and service to natural gas market and one non reportable segment all other see note and to the financial statement for additional information many factor affect the opportunity challenge and risk of the southern company system electric service and natural gas business these factor include the ability to maintain constructive regulatory environment to maintain and grow sale and customer and to effectively manage and secure timely recovery of prudently incurred cost these cost include those related to projected long term demand growth stringent environmental standard including ccr rule safety system reliability and resilience fuel natural gas restoration following major storm and capital expenditure including constructing new electric generating plant and expanding and improving the electric transmission and electric and natural gas distribution system the traditional electric operating company and the natural gas distribution utility have various regulatory mechanism that address cost recovery effectively operating pursuant to these regulatory mechanism and appropriately balancing required cost and capital expenditure with customer price will continue to challenge the southern company system for the foreseeable future see note to the financial statement for additional information southern power future earnings will depend upon the parameter of the wholesale market and the efficient operation of it wholesale generating asset well southern power ability to execute it growth strategy and to develop and construct generating facility in addition southern power future earnings will depend upon the availability of federal and state itcs and ptcs on it renewable energy project which could be impacted by future tax legislation see future earnings potential income tax matter herein and note and to the financial statement for additional information southern company other business activity include providing energy solution to electric utility and their customer in the area of distributed generation energy storage and renewables and energy efficiency other business activity also include investment in telecommunication leveraged lease project and gas storage facility management continues to evaluate the contribution of each of these activity to total shareholder return and may pursue acquisition disposition and other strategic venture or investment accordingly ii table of content index to financial statement combined management discussion and analysis continued southern company and subsidiary company annual reportrecent developmentscovid march covid wa declared pandemic by the world health organization and the center for disease control and prevention and ha spread globally including throughout the united state the southern company system provides an essential service to it customer therefore it is critical that southern company system employee are able to continue to perform their essential duty safely and effectively the southern company system ha implemented applicable business continuity plan including teleworking canceling non essential business travel increasing cleaning frequency at business location implementing applicable safety and health guideline issued by federal and state official and establishing protocol for required work on customer premise to date these procedure have been effective in maintaining the southern company system critical operation result of the covid pandemic there have been economic disruption in the registrant operating territory the traditional electric operating company and the natural gas distribution utility temporarily suspended disconnection for non payment by customer and waived late fee for certain period see note to the financial statement for information regarding deferral of certain incremental covid related cost including bad debt to regulatory asset by certain of the traditional electric operating company and the natural gas distribution utility in addition the covid pandemic ha impacted productivity and the pace of activity completion at plant vogtle unit and discussed further herein additional information regarding the covid pandemic and it past and potential future impact on the registrant is provided subcontract and procurement among other factor these factor continue to represent further potential cost risk to the project therefore georgia power established million of additional contingency of power acting for itself and agent for the other vogtle owner announced reduction in workforce at plant vogtle unit and and began reducing the then existing site workforce by approximately this workforce reduction lowered absenteeism providing an improvement in operational efficiency and allowing for increased social distancing since april the number of active case at the site ha fluctuated and ha continued to impact productivity level and pace of activity completion from november through january the number of active covid case at the site increased significantly consistent with national weather condition management also considers this metric in developing long term capital and financial plan change in retail energy sale are generally the result of change in electricity usage by revenue from wholesale gas service decreased in primarily due to lower derivative gain and decreased commercial activity result of warmer weather southern company gas hedged it exposure to warmer than normal weather in illinois for gas distribution operation and in illinois and georgia for gas marketing service the remaining impact of weather on earnings were immaterial cost of natural gasexcluding atlanta gas light which doe not sell natural gas to end use customer the natural gas distribution utility charge their utility customer for natural gas consumed using natural gas cost recovery mechanism set by the applicable state regulatory agency under these mechanism all prudently incurred natural gas cost are passed through to customer without markup subject to regulatory review the natural gas distribution utility defer or accrue the difference between the actual cost of natural gas and the amount of commodity revenue earned in given period the deferred or accrued amount is either billed or refunded to customer prospectively through adjustment to the commodity rate deferred natural gas cost are reflected regulatory asset and accrued natural gas cost are reflected regulatory liability therefore gas cost recovered through natural gas revenue generally equal the amount expensed in cost of natural gas and do not affect net income from the natural gas distribution utility cost of natural gas at the natural gas distribution utility represented of the total cost of natural gas for gas marketing service customer are charged for actual and estimated natural gas december and in thousand except market share gas distribution gas marketing servicesenergy customer market share of energy customer in gas marketing service customer are primarily located in georgia and illinois december also includes approximately customer in ohio contracted through an annual auction process to serve for month beginning april southern company gas anticipates continued customer growth it expects continued low natural gas price southern company gas us variety of targeted marketing program to attract new customer and to retain existing customer cost of natural gas excluding atlanta gas light which doe not sell natural gas to end use customer gas distribution operation charge it utility customer for natural gas consumed using natural gas cost recovery mechanism set by the applicable state regulatory agency under these mechanism all prudently incurred natural gas cost are passed through to customer without markup subject to regulatory review gas distribution operation defers or accrues the difference between the actual cost of natural gas and the amount of commodity revenue earned in given period the deferred or accrued amount is either billed or refunded to customer prospectively through adjustment to the commodity rate deferred natural gas cost are reflected regulatory asset and accrued natural gas cost are reflected regulatory liability therefore gas cost recovered through natural gas revenue generally equal the amount expensed in cost of natural gas and do not affect net income from gas distribution operation cost of natural gas at gas distribution operation represented of the total cost of natural gas for gas marketing service customer are charged for actual and estimated natural gas consumed cost of natural gas includes the cost of fuel and associated transportation cost lost and unaccounted for gas adjustment to reduce the value of inventory to market value if applicable and gain and loss associated with certain derivative regulatory action authorized under the previous administration before they become effective president biden also signed executive order related to federal regulation and subsequently signed additional order to address climate change and other environmental issue air qualitythe southern company system reduced and nox air emission by and respectively from to the southern company system reduced mercury air emission by over from to the epa finalized regional haze regulation in and these regulation require state tribal government and various federal agency to develop and implement plan to reduce pollutant that impair visibility and demonstrate reasonable progress toward the goal of restoring natural visibility condition in certain area including national park and wilderness area state are required to submit state implementation plan for the second year planning period through by july these plan could require further reduction in particulate matter and or nox which could result in increased compliance cost at affected electric generating unit water qualityin the epa finalized requirement under section of the clean water act cwa to regulate cooling water intake structure cwis to minimize their effect on fish and other aquatic life at existing power plant the regulation requires plant specific study to determine applicable cwis change to protect organism the result of these plant specific study which are ongoing within the southern company system are being submitted with each plant next national pollutant discharge elimination system npdes permit cycle the southern company system anticipates applicable cwis change may include fish friendly cwis screen with fish return system and minor addition of monitoring equipment at certain plant the impact of this rule will depend on the outcome of these plant specific study any additional protective measure required to be incorporated into each plant npdes permit based on site specific factor and the outcome of any legal challenge in the epa finalized the steam electric effluent limitation guideline elg rule elg rule that set national standard for wastewater discharge from new and existing steam electric generating unit generating greater than mws including substantially all of the coal fired generating unit in the southern company system the elg rule prohibits effluent discharge of certain wastestreams and imposes stringent limit on flue gas desulfurization fgd wastewater discharge on october the epa published the final elg reconsideration rule reconsideration of the elg rule limit on bottom ash transport water and fgd wastewater that extends the latest applicability date for both discharge to december the elg reconsideration rule also update the voluntary incentive program and provides new subcategories for low utilization electric generating unit and electric generating unit that will permanently cease coal combustion by an initial notice of planned participation nopp must be submitted to the applicable permitting authority no later than october for unit seeking to qualify for these subcategories subsequent nopp must be submitted to transfer unit to an alternative compliance option the elg rule and the elg reconsideration rule elg rule are expected to require capital expenditure and increased operational cost for the traditional electric operating company and segco for georgia power plant wansley unit and which are currently challenged due to their operating profile and position within the economic dispatch the anticipated cost of the control necessary to comply with the elg rule could accelerate determination that continued operation is uneconomical result georgia power may request in it irp filing to accelerate the retirement of these unit which had net book value totaling approximately million at december however the ultimate impact of the elg rule will depend on the southern company system final assessment of compliance option the incorporation of these assessment into each of the traditional electric operating company irp process the incorporation of these new requirement into each generating unit npdes permit and the outcome of legal challenge the elg reconsideration rule ha been challenged by several environmental organization and the case have been consolidated in the court of appeal for the fourth circuit ii table of content index to financial statement combined management discussion and analysis continued southern company and subsidiary company annual reportcoal combustion residualsin the epa finalized non hazardous solid waste regulation for the disposal of ccr including coal ash and gypsum in landfill and surface impoundment ash pond at active electric generating power plant the ccr rule requires landfill and ash pond to be evaluated against set of performance criterion and potentially closed if certain criterion are not met closure of existing landfill and ash pond requires installation of equipment and infrastructure to manage ccr in accordance with the ccr rule the epa is in the process of amending portion of the ccr rule in addition to the ccr rule the state of alabama and georgia finalized state regulation regarding the handling of ccr within their respective state the state of georgia received approval from the epa on it partial permit program implementing the state ccr permit program in lieu of the federal self implementing rule in accordance with the water infrastructure improvement for the nation act on february revision to align state of alabama regulation with the federal ccr rule became effective approved by the alabama environmental management commission the state of mississippi ha not yet developed state ccr permit program based on requirement for closure and monitoring of landfill and ash pond pursuant to the ccr rule and applicable state rule the traditional electric operating company have periodically updated and expect to continue periodically updating their information global climate issuesin july the epa published the final affordable clean energy rule ace rule to repeal and replace the cpp the ace rule requires state to develop unit specific emission rate standard for existing coal fired unit based on heat rate efficiency improvement on january the circuit court of appeal vacated and remanded the ace rule back to the epa once the decision becomes final the ace rule will no longer be in effect on january president biden accepted the paris agreement on behalf of the united state which will result in the united state officially becoming party to the agreement on february the paris agreement establishes non binding universal framework for addressing ghg emission based on nationally determined emission reduction contribution and set in place process for tracking progress towards the goal every five year additional ghg policy including legislation may emerge in the future requiring the united state to transition to lower ghg emitting economy however associated impact are currently unknown the southern company system ha transitioned from an electric generating mix of coal and natural gas in to mix of coal and natural gas in along with over mws of renewable resource capacity this transition ha been supported in part by the southern company system retiring over mws of coal and oil fired generating capacity since and converting over mws of generating capacity from coal to natural gas since in addition southern company gas ha replaced over mile of pipe material that wa more prone to fugitive emission unprotected steel and cast iron pipe resulting in mitigation of more than million metric ton of equivalent from it natural gas distribution system since ii table of content index to financial statement combined management five year southern power power sale agreementsgeneralsouthern power ha ppas with some of the traditional electric operating company other investor owned utility ipps municipality and other load serving entity well commercial and industrial customer the ppas are expected to provide southern power with stable source of revenue during their respective term many of southern power ppas have provision that require southern power or the counterparty to post collateral or an acceptable substitute guarantee if or moody downgrade the credit rating of the respective company to an unacceptable credit rating ii the counterparty is not rated or iii the counterparty fails to maintain minimum coverage ratio southern power is working to maintain and expand it share of the wholesale market during southern power continued to be successful in remarketing mws to mws of annual natural gas generation capacity to load serving entity through several ppas extending over the next year market demand is being driven by load serving entity replacing expired purchase contract and or retired generation well planning for future growth however generation capacity market forecast indicate an oversupply especially in the southeast and the highly competitive remarketing environment is expected to continue in the near term natural gassouthern power electricity sale from natural gas facility are primarily through long term ppas that consist of two type of agreement the first type referred to unit or block sale is customer purchase from dedicated generating unit where all or portion of the generation from that unit is reserved for that customer southern power typically ha the ability to serve the unit or block sale customer from an alternate resource the second type referred to requirement service provides that southern power serve the customer capacity and energy requirement from combination of the customer own generating unit and from southern power resource not dedicated to serve unit or block sale southern power ha right to purchase power provided by the requirement customer resource when economically viable general matter substantially all of the ppas provide that the purchaser are responsible for either procuring the fuel tolling agreement or reimbursing southern power for substantially all of the cost of fuel or purchased power relating to the energy delivered under such ppas to the extent particular generating facility doe not meet the operational requirement contemplated in the ppas southern power may be responsible for excess fuel cost with respect to fuel transportation risk most of southern power ppas provide that the counterparties are responsible for the availability of fuel transportation to the particular generating facility capacity charge that form part of the ppa payment are designed to recover fixed and variable operation and maintenance cost based on dollar per kilowatt year in general to reduce southern power exposure to certain operation and maintenance cost southern power ha ltsas see note to the financial statement under long term service agreement for additional information solar and windsouthern power electricity sale from solar and wind renewable generating facility are also primarily through long term ppas however these solar and wind ppas do not have capacity charge and customer either purchase the energy output of dedicated renewable facility through an energy charge or provide southern power certain fixed price for the electricity sold to the grid result southern power ability to recover fixed and variable operation and maintenance expense is dependent upon the level of energy generated from these facility which can be impacted by weather condition equipment performance transmission constraint and other factor generally under the renewable generation ppas the purchasing party retains the right to keep or resell the renewable energy credit southern company gas affiliate asset management agreementswith the exception of nicor gas the natural gas distribution utility use asset management agreement with an affiliate sequent for the primary purpose of reducing utility customer assistance program rather than reduction to gas cost recovery rate under these asset management agreement sequent supply natural gas to the utility and market available pipeline and storage capacity utility regulation southern company alabama power georgia power mississippi power and southern company gas the traditional electric operating company and the natural gas distribution utility are subject to retail regulation by their respective state pscs or other applicable state regulatory agency and wholesale regulation by the ferc these regulatory agency set the rate the traditional electric operating company and the natural gas distribution utility are permitted to charge customer based on allowable cost including reasonable roe result the traditional electric operating company and the natural gas distribution utility apply accounting standard which require the financial statement to reflect the effect of rate regulation through the ratemaking process the regulator may require the inclusion of cost or revenue in period different than when they would be recognized by non regulated company this treatment may result in the deferral of expense and the recording of related regulatory asset based on anticipated future recovery through rate or the deferral of gain or creation of liability and the recording of related regulatory liability the application of the accounting standard for rate regulated entity also impact their financial statement result of the estimate of allowable cost used in the ratemaking process these estimate may differ from those actually incurred by the traditional electric operating company and the natural gas distribution utility therefore the accounting estimate inherent in specific cost such depreciation aros and pension and other postretirement benefit have le of direct impact on the result of operation and financial condition of the applicable registrant than they would on non regulated company revenue related to regulated utility operation percentage of total operating revenue in for the applicable registrant were follows for southern company for alabama power for georgia power for mississippi power and for southern company gas reflected in note to the financial statement significant regulatory asset and liability have been recorded management review the ultimate recoverability of these regulatory asset and any requirement to refund these regulatory liability based on applicable regulatory guideline and gaap however adverse legislative judicial or regulatory action could materially impact the amount planning strategy if necessary and interpretation of applicable tax law and regulation across multiple taxing jurisdiction the effective tax rate reflects the statutory tax rate and calculated apportionment for the various state in which the southern company system operates southern company file consolidated federal income tax return and the registrant file various state income tax return some of which are combined or unitary under joint consolidated income tax allocation agreement each southern company subsidiary current and deferred tax expense is computed on stand alone basis and each subsidiary is allocated an amount of tax similar to that which would be paid if it filed separate income tax return in accordance with irs regulation each company is jointly and severally liable for the federal tax liability certain deduction and credit can be limited or utilized at the consolidated or combined level resulting in tax credit and or state nol carryforwards that would not otherwise result on stand alone basis utilization of these carryforwards and the assessment of valuation allowance are based on significant judgment and extensive analysis of southern company and it subsidiary current financial position and result of operation including currently available information about future year to estimate when future taxable income will be realized current and deferred state income tax liability and asset are estimated based on law of multiple state that determine the income to be apportioned to their jurisdiction state have various filing methodology and utilize specific formula to calculate the apportionment of taxable income the calculation of deferred state tax considers apportionment factor and filing methodology that are expected to apply in future year the apportionment and methodology which are ultimately finalized in manner inconsistent with expectation could have material effect on the financial statement of the applicable registrant given the significant judgment involved in estimating tax credit and or state nol carryforwards and multi state apportionment for all subsidiary the applicable registrant consider deferred income tax liability and asset to be critical accounting estimate asset retirement obligation southern company alabama power georgia power mississippi power and southern company gas aros are computed the present value of the estimated cost for an asset future retirement and are recorded in the period in which the liability is incurred the estimated cost are capitalized part of the related long lived asset and depreciated over the asset useful life in the absence of quoted market price aros are estimated using present value technique in which estimate of future cash outlay associated with the asset retirement are discounted using credit adjusted risk free rate estimate of the timing and amount of future cash outlay are based on projection of when and how the asset will be retired and the cost of future removal activity the aro liability for the traditional electric operating company primarily relate to facility that are subject to the ccr rule and the related state rule principally ash pond in addition alabama power and georgia power have retirement obligation related to the decommissioning of nuclear facility alabama power plant farley and georgia power ownership interest in plant hatch and plant vogtle unit and other significant aros include various landfill site and asbestos removal for alabama power georgia power and mississippi power and gypsum cell and mine reclamation for mississippi power the traditional electric operating company and southern company gas also have identified other retirement obligation such obligation related to certain electric transmission and distribution facility certain asbestos containing material within long term asset not subject to ongoing repair and maintenance activity certain wireless communication tower the disposal of polychlorinated biphenyls in certain transformer leasehold improvement equipment on customer property and property associated with the southern company system rail line and natural gas pipeline however liability for the removal of these asset have not been recorded because the settlement timing for certain retirement obligation related to these asset is indeterminable and therefore the fair value of the retirement obligation can not be reasonably estimated liability for these retirement obligation will be recognized when sufficient information becomes available to support reasonable estimation of the aro the cost estimate for aros related to the disposal of ccr are based on information using various assumption related to closure and post closure cost timing of future cash outlay acquisition method of accounting requires the asset acquired and liability assumed to be recorded at the date of acquisition at their respective estimated fair value the applicable registrant have recognized goodwill of the date of their acquisition residual over the fair value of the identifiable net asset acquired goodwill is tested for impairment at the reporting unit level on an annual basis in the fourth quarter of the year well on an interim basis event and change in circumstance occur including but not limited to significant change in operating performance the business climate legal or regulatory factor or planned sale or disposition of significant portion of the business reporting unit is the operating segment or business one level below the operating segment component if discrete financial information is prepared and regularly reviewed by management component are aggregated if they have similar economic characteristic part of the impairment test the applicable registrant may perform an initial qualitative assessment to determine whether it is more likely than not that the fair value of each reporting unit is le than it carrying amount before applying the quantitative goodwill impairment test if the applicable registrant elect to perform the qualitative assessment it evaluates relevant event and circumstance including but not limited to macroeconomic condition industry and market condition cost factor financial performance entity specific event and event specific to each reporting unit if the applicable registrant determines that it is more likely than not that the fair value of reporting unit is le than it carrying amount or it elect not to perform qualitative assessment it compare the fair value of the reporting unit to it carrying value to determine if the fair value is greater than it carrying value goodwill for southern company and southern company gas wa billion and billion respectively at december for it annual impairment test should be recorded the applicable registrant consider these estimate to be critical accounting estimate see note to the financial statement under goodwill and other intangible asset and liability for additional information regarding the applicable registrant goodwill long lived asset southern company southern power and southern company gas impairment of long lived asset of the traditional electric utility and natural gas distribution utility are generally related to specific regulatory disallowances the applicable registrant ass their other long lived asset for impairment whenever event or change in circumstance indicate that an asset carrying amount may not be recoverable if an indicator exists the asset is tested for recoverability by comparing the asset carrying value to the sum of the undiscounted expected future cash flow directly attributable to the asset use and eventual disposition if the estimate of undiscounted future cash flow is le than the carrying value of the asset the fair value of the asset is determined and loss is recorded equal to the difference between the carrying value and the fair value of the asset in addition when asset are identified held for sale an impairment loss is recognized to the extent the carrying value of the asset or asset group exceeds their fair value le cost to sell high degree of judgment is required in developing estimate related to these evaluation which are based on projection of various factor some of which have been quite volatile in recent year southern power investment in long lived asset are primarily generation asset excluding the natural gas distribution utility southern company gas investment in long lived asset are primarily natural gas transportation and storage facility asset whether in service or under construction in addition exclusive of the traditional electric operating company and natural gas distribution utility southern company investment in long lived asset also include investment in leveraged lease during southern company recorded impairment charge totaling million million after tax related to two of it leveraged lease investment for southern power example of impairment indicator
