subsidiary company annual reportderivatives and hedging activity southern company and southern company gas determining whether contract meet the definition of derivative instrument contains an embedded derivative requiring bifurcation or qualifies for hedge accounting treatment is complex the treatment of single contract may vary from period to period depending upon accounting election change in the applicable registrant assessment of the likelihood of future hedged transaction or new interpretation of accounting guidance result judgment is required in determining the appropriate accounting treatment in addition the estimated fair value of derivative instrument may change significantly from period to period depending upon market condition and change in hedge effectiveness may impact the accounting treatment derivative instrument including certain derivative instrument embedded in other contract are recorded on the balance sheet either asset or liability measured at their fair value if the transaction qualifies for and is designated normal purchase or normal sale it is exempt from fair value accounting treatment and is instead subject to traditional accrual accounting the applicable registrant utilizes market data or assumption that market participant would use in pricing the derivative asset or liability including assumption about risk and the risk inherent in the input of the valuation technique change in the derivative fair value are recognized concurrently in earnings unless specific hedge accounting criterion are met if the derivative meet those criterion derivative gain and loss offset related result of the hedged item in the income statement in the case of fair value hedge or gain and loss are deferred in oci on the balance sheet until the hedged transaction affect earnings in the case of cash flow hedge additionally company is required to formally designate derivative hedge well document and ass the effectiveness of derivative associated with transaction that receive hedge accounting treatment southern company gas us derivative instrument primarily to reduce the impact to it result of operation due to the risk of change in the price of natural gas and to lesser extent southern company gas hedge against warmer than normal weather and interest rate the majority of these contract are over the counter wholesale contract for the purchase or sale of natural gas or consist of contract which do not include asset management agreement financial optionality or potential embedded derivative the fair value of natural gas derivative instrument used to manage exposure to changing natural gas price reflects the estimated amount that southern company gas would receive or pay to terminate or close the contract at the reporting date taking into account the current unrealized gain or loss on open contract for derivative utilized at gas marketing service and wholesale gas service that are not designated accounting hedge change in fair value are reported gain or loss in result of operation in the period of change gas marketing service record derivative gain or loss arising from cash flow hedge in oci and reclassifies them into earnings in the same period that the underlying hedged item is recognized in earnings derivative asset and liability are classified based on the lowest level of input that is significant to the fair value measurement the assessment of the significance of particular input to the fair value measurement requires judgment and may affect the valuation of fair value asset and liability and their placement within the fair value hierarchy the determination of the fair value of the derivative instrument incorporates various required factor these factor include the creditworthiness of the counterparties involved and the impact of credit enhancement such cash deposit and letter of credit event specific to given counterparty and the impact of nonperformance risk on liability significant change in the underlying market price or pricing assumption used in pricing derivative asset or liability may result in significant financial statement impact given the assumption used in pricing the derivative asset or liability southern company and southern company gas consider the valuation of derivative asset and liability critical accounting estimate see financial condition and liquidity market price risk herein and note to the financial statement for more information revenue recognition southern power southern power power sale transaction which include ppas are classified in one of four general category lease non derivative or normal sale derivative derivative designated cash flow hedge and derivative not designated hedge the two category with the most judgment required for southern power are described further below southern power revenue are dependent upon significant judgment used to determine the appropriate transaction classification which must be documented upon the inception of each contract lease transactionssouthern power considers the term of sale contract to determine whether it should be accounted for lease contract is or contains lease if the contract conveys the right to control the use of identified property plant or equipment for period of time in exchange for consideration if the contract meet the criterion for lease southern power performs further analysis to determine ii table of content index to financial statement combined management discussion and analysis continued southern company and subsidiary company annual reportwhether the lease is classified operating financing or sale type generally all of southern power power sale contract that are determined to be lease are accounted for operating lease and the capacity revenue is recognized on straight line basis over the term of the contract and is included in southern power operating revenue energy revenue and other contingent revenue are recognized in the period the energy is delivered or the service is rendered see note to the financial statement for additional information non derivative and normal sale derivative transactionsif the power sale contract is not classified lease southern power further considers whether the contract meet the definition of derivative if the contract doe meet the definition of derivative southern power will ass whether it can be designated normal sale contract the determination of whether contract can be designated normal sale contract requires judgment including whether the sale of electricity involves physical delivery in quantity within southern power available generating capacity and that the purchaser will take quantity expected to be used or sold in the normal course of business contract that do not meet the definition of derivative or are designated normal sale are accounted for executory contract for contract that have capacity charge the revenue is generally recognized in the period that it becomes billable revenue related to energy and ancillary service are recognized in the period the energy is delivered or the service is rendered see note to the financial statement for additional information acquisition accounting southern power southern power may acquire generation asset part of it overall growth strategy at the time of an acquisition southern power will ass if these asset and activity meet the definition of business for acquisition that meet the definition of business the purchase price including any contingent consideration is allocated based on the fair value of the identifiable asset acquired and liability assumed including any intangible asset primarily related to acquired ppas asset acquired that do not meet the definition of business are accounted for an asset acquisition the purchase price of each asset acquisition is allocated based on the relative fair value of asset acquired determining the fair value of asset acquired and liability assumed requires management judgment and southern power may engage independent valuation expert to assist in this process fair value are determined by using market participant assumption and typically include the timing and amount of future cash flow incurred construction cost the nature of acquired contract discount rate power market price and expected asset life any due diligence or transition cost incurred by southern power for potential or successful acquisition are expensed incurred see note to the financial statement for additional fair value information and note to the financial statement for additional information on recent acquisition variable interest entity southern power southern power enters into partnership with varying ownership structure upon entering into these arrangement membership interest and other variable interest are evaluated to determine if the legal entity is vie if the legal entity is vie southern power will ass if it ha both the power to direct the activity of the vie that most significantly impact the vie economic performance and the obligation to absorb loss or the right to receive benefit from the vie that could potentially be significant to the vie making it the primary beneficiary making this determination may require significant management judgment if southern power is the primary beneficiary and is considered to have controlling ownership the asset liability and result of operation of the entity are consolidated if southern power is not the primary beneficiary the legal entity is generally accounted for under the equity method of accounting southern power reconsiders it conclusion to whether the legal entity is vie and whether it is the primary beneficiary for event that impact the right of variable interest such ownership change in membership interest southern power ha controlling ownership in certain legal entity for which the contractual provision represent profit sharing arrangement because the allocation of cash distribution and tax benefit are not based on fixed ownership percentage for these arrangement the noncontrolling interest is accounted for under balance sheet approach utilizing the hlbv method the hlbv method calculates each partner share of income based on the change in net equity the partner can legally claim in hlbv at the end of the period compared to the beginning of the period contingent obligation all registrant accounting standard for additional information on march the fasb issued asu reference rate reform topic facilitation of the effect of reference rate reform on financial reporting asu providing temporary guidance to ease the potential burden in accounting for reference rate reform primarily resulting from the discontinuation of libor which is currently expected to begin phasing out on december the amendment in asu are elective and apply to all entity that have contract hedging relationship and other transaction that reference libor or another reference rate expected to be discontinued the new guidance provides the following optional expedient simplifies accounting analysis under current gaap for contract modification ii simplifies the assessment of hedge effectiveness and allows hedging relationship affected by reference rate reform to continue and iii allows one time election to sell or transfer debt security classified held to maturity that reference rate affected by reference rate reform an entity may elect to apply the amendment prospectively from march through december by accounting topic the registrant currently reference libor for certain debt and hedging arrangement contract language ha been or is expected to be incorporated into each of these agreement to address the transition to an alternative rate for agreement that will be in place at the transition date while existing effective hedging relationship are expected to continue the registrant will continue to evaluate the provision of asu and the impact of transitioning to an alternative rate the ultimate outcome of the transition can not be determined at this time but is not expected to have material impact on the registrant financial statement see financial condition and liquidity company and subsidiary company annual reportdue to cost based rate regulation and other various cost recovery mechanism the traditional electric operating company and the natural gas distribution utility that sell natural gas directly to end use customer continue to have limited exposure to market volatility in interest rate foreign currency exchange rate commodity fuel price and price of electricity the traditional electric operating company and certain of the natural gas distribution utility manage fuel hedging program implemented per the guideline of their respective state pscs or other applicable state regulatory agency to hedge the impact of market fluctuation in natural gas price for customer mississippi power also manages wholesale fuel hedging program under agreement with it wholesale customer because energy from southern power facility is primarily sold under long term ppas with tolling agreement and provision shifting substantially all of the responsibility for fuel cost to the counterparties southern power exposure to market volatility in commodity fuel price and price of electricity is generally limited however southern power ha been and may continue to be exposed to market volatility in energy related commodity price result of uncontracted generating capacity to mitigate residual risk relative to movement in electricity price the traditional electric operating company and southern power may enter into physical fixed price contract for the purchase and sale of electricity through the wholesale electricity market and to lesser extent financial hedge contract for natural gas purchase however significant portion of contract are priced at market certain of southern company gas non regulated operation routinely utilize various type of derivative instrument to economically hedge certain commodity price and weather risk inherent in the natural gas industry these instrument include variety of exchange traded and otc energy contract such forward contract future contract option contract and swap agreement southern company gas gas marketing service and wholesale gas service business also actively manage storage position through variety of hedging transaction for the purpose of managing exposure arising from changing natural gas price these hedging instrument are used to substantially protect economic margin spread between wholesale and retail natural gas price widen between period and thereby minimize exposure to declining operating margin some of these economic hedge activity may not qualify or may not be designated for hedge to certain leveraged lease investment southern company gas value at risk var var is the maximum potential loss in portfolio value over specified time period that is not expected to be exceeded within given degree of probability southern company gas var may not be comparable to that of other company due to difference in the factor used to calculate var southern company gas var is determined on confidence interval and one day holding period which mean that of the time the risk of loss in day from portfolio of position is expected to be le than or equal to the amount of var calculated the open exposure of southern company gas is managed in accordance with established policy that limit market risk and require daily reporting of potential financial exposure to senior management because southern company gas generally manages physical gas asset and economically protects it position by hedging in the ii table of content index to financial statement combined management discussion and exposure at december the top counterparties of southern company gas wholesale gas service segment represented approximately or million of it total counterparty exposure and had weighted average equivalent credit rating of all of which is consistent with the prior year the equivalent credit rating is determined by process of converting the lower of the or moody rating to an internal rating ranging from to with being equivalent to aaa aaa by and moody respectively and being default by and moody respectively counterparty that doe not have an external rating is assigned an internal rating based on the strength of the financial ratio of that counterparty to arrive at the weighted average credit rating each counterparty is assigned an internal ratio which is multiplied by their credit exposure and summed for all counterparties the sum is divided by the aggregate total counterparties exposure and this numeric value is then converted to equivalent the following table provides credit company southern company of december and the related consolidated statement of income comprehensive income stockholder equity and cash flow for each of the three year in the period ended december and the related note collectively referred to the financial statement also have audited southern company internal control over financial reporting of december based on criterion established in internal control integrated framework issued by the committee of sponsoring organization of the treadway commission coso in our opinion the financial statement referred to above present fairly in all material respect the financial position of southern company of december and and the result of it operation and it cash flow for each of the three year in the period ended december in conformity with accounting principle generally accepted in the united state of america also in our opinion southern company maintained in all material respect effective internal control over financial reporting of december based on criterion established in internal control integrated framework issued by coso basis for opinionssouthern company management is responsible for these financial statement for maintaining effective internal control over financial reporting and for it assessment of the effectiveness of internal control over financial reporting included in the accompanying management report on internal control over financial reporting our responsibility is to express an opinion on these financial statement and an opinion on southern company internal control over financial reporting based on our audit we are public accounting firm registered with the public company accounting oversight board united state pcaob and are required to be independent with respect to southern company in accordance with the federal security law and the applicable rule and regulation of the security and exchange commission and the pcaob we conducted our audit in accordance with the standard of the pcaob those standard require that we plan and perform the audit to obtain reasonable assurance about whether the financial statement are free of material misstatement whether due to error or fraud and whether effective internal control over financial reporting wa maintained in all material respect our audit of the consolidated financial statement included performing procedure to ass the risk of material misstatement of the financial statement whether due to error or fraud and performing procedure to respond to those risk such procedure included examining on test basis evidence regarding the amount and disclosure in the financial statement our audit also included evaluating the accounting principle used and significant estimate made by management well evaluating the overall presentation of the financial statement our audit of internal control over financial reporting included obtaining an understanding of internal control over financial reporting assessing the risk that material weakness exists and testing and evaluating the design and operating effectiveness of internal control based on the assessed risk our audit also included performing such other procedure we considered necessary in the circumstance we believe that our audit provide reasonable basis for our opinion definition and limitation of internal control over financial reportinga company internal control over financial reporting is process designed to provide reasonable assurance regarding the reliability of financial reporting and the preparation of financial statement for external purpose in accordance with generally accepted accounting principle company internal control over financial reporting includes those policy and procedure that pertain to the maintenance of record that in reasonable detail accurately and fairly reflect the transaction and disposition of the asset of the company provide reasonable assurance that transaction are recorded necessary to permit preparation of financial statement in accordance with generally accepted accounting principle and that receipt and expenditure of the company are being made only in accordance with authorization of management and director of the company and provide reasonable assurance regarding prevention or timely detection of unauthorized acquisition use or disposition of the company asset that could have material effect on the financial statement because of it inherent limitation internal control over financial reporting may not prevent or detect misstatement also projection of any evaluation of effectiveness to future period are subject to the risk that control may become inadequate because of change in condition or that the degree of compliance with the policy or procedure may deteriorate ii table of content index to financial statementscritical audit mattersthe critical audit matter communicated below are matter arising from the current period audit of the financial statement that were communicated or required to be communicated to the audit committee of southern company board of director and that relate to account or disclosure that are material to the financial statement and involved our especially challenging subjective or complex judgment the communication of critical audit matter doe not alter in any way our opinion on the financial statement taken whole and we are not by communicating the regulation by the federal energy regulatory commission collectively the commission management ha determined that the regulated utility subsidiary meet the requirement under accounting principle generally accepted in the united state of america to utilize specialized rule to account for the effect of rate regulation in the preparation of it financial statement accounting for the economics of rate regulation impact multiple financial statement line item and disclosure including but not limited to property plant and equipment other regulatory asset other regulatory liability other cost of removal obligation deferred charge and credit related to income tax under and over recovered regulatory clause revenue operating revenue operation and maintenance expense and depreciation and amortization the commission set the rate the regulated utility subsidiary are permitted to charge customer rate are determined and approved in regulatory proceeding based on an analysis of the applicable regulated utility subsidiary cost to provide utility service and return on and recovery of it investment in the utility business current and future regulatory decision can have an impact on the recovery of cost the rate of return earned on investment and the timing and amount of asset to be recovered by rate the commission regulation of rate is premised on the full recovery of prudently incurred cost and reasonable rate of return on invested capital while southern company regulated utility subsidiary expect to recover cost from customer through regulated rate there is risk that the commission will not approve full recovery of the cost of providing utility service or full recovery of all amount invested in the utility business and reasonable return on that investment we identified the impact of rate regulation critical audit matter due to the significant judgment made by management to support it assertion about impacted account balance and disclosure asset retirement cost property damage reserve and net book value of retired asset and the high degree of subjectivity involved in assessing the potential impact of future regulatory order on the financial statement management judgment include assessing the likelihood of recovery in future rate of incurred cost disallowance of part of the cost of recently completed plant or plant under construction and or refund to customer given that management accounting judgment are based on assumption about the outcome of future decision by the commission auditing these judgment required specialized knowledge of accounting for rate regulation and the rate setting process due to it inherent complexity and significant auditor judgment to evaluate management estimate and the subjectivity of audit evidence how independent registered public accounting firmto the stockholder and the board of director of alabama power companyopinion on the financial statementswe have audited the accompanying balance sheet of alabama power company alabama power wholly owned subsidiary of the southern company of december and the related statement of income comprehensive income common stockholder equity and cash flow for each of the three year in the period ended december and the related note collectively referred to the financial statement in our opinion the financial statement present fairly in all material respect the financial position of alabama power of december and and the result of it operation and it cash flow for each of the three year in the period ended december in conformity with accounting principle generally accepted in the united state of america basis for opinionthese financial statement are the responsibility of alabama power management our responsibility is to express an opinion on alabama power financial statement based on our audit we are public accounting firm registered with the public company accounting oversight board united state pcaob and are required to be independent with respect to alabama power in accordance with the federal security law and the applicable rule and regulation of the security and exchange commission and the pcaob we conducted our audit in accordance with the standard of the pcaob those standard require that we plan and perform the audit to obtain reasonable assurance about whether the financial statement are free of material misstatement whether due to error or fraud alabama power is not required to have nor were we engaged to perform an audit of it internal control over financial reporting part of our audit we are required to obtain an understanding of internal control over financial reporting but not for the purpose of expressing an opinion on the effectiveness of alabama power internal control over financial reporting accordingly we express no such opinion our audit included performing procedure to ass the risk of material misstatement of the financial statement whether due to error or fraud and performing procedure that respond to those risk such procedure included examining on test basis evidence regarding the amount and disclosure in the financial statement our audit also included evaluating the accounting principle used and significant estimate made by management well evaluating the overall presentation of the financial statement we believe that our audit provide reasonable basis for our opinion critical audit matterthe critical audit matter communicated below is matter arising from the current period audit of the financial statement that wa communicated or required to be communicated to the audit committee of southern company board of director and that relates to account or disclosure that are material to the financial statement and involved our especially challenging subjective or complex judgment the communication of critical audit matter doe not alter in any way our opinion on the financial statement taken whole and we are not by communicating the critical audit matter below providing separate opinion on the critical audit matter or on the account or disclosure to which it relates impact of rate regulation on the financial statement refer to note summary of significant accounting policy regulatory asset and liability and note regulatory matter alabama power to the financial statementscritical audit matter descriptionalabama power is subject to retail rate regulation by the alabama public service commission and wholesale regulation by the federal energy regulatory commission collectively the commission management ha determined that it meet the requirement under accounting principle generally accepted in the united state of america to utilize specialized rule to account for the effect of rate regulation in the preparation of it financial statement accounting for the economics of rate regulation impact multiple financial statement line item and disclosure including but not limited to property plant and equipment other regulatory asset other regulatory liability other cost of removal obligation deferred charge and credit related to income tax under and over recovered regulatory clause revenue operating revenue operation and maintenance expense and depreciation and amortization the commission set the rate alabama power is permitted to charge customer rate are determined and approved in regulatory proceeding based on an analysis of alabama power cost to provide utility service and return on and recovery of it investment in the utility business current and future regulatory decision can have an impact on the recovery of cost the rate of return earned on investment and the timing and amount of asset to be recovered by rate the commission regulation of rate is premised on the full recovery of prudently incurred cost and reasonable rate of return on invested capital while alabama power expects to recover cost from customer through regulated rate there is risk that the commission will not approve ii table of content index to financial statementsfull recovery of the cost of providing utility service or full recovery of all amount invested in the utility business and reasonable return on that investment we identified the impact of rate regulation critical audit matter due to the significant judgment made by management to support it assertion about impacted account balance and disclosure asset retirement cost and the net book value of retired asset and the high degree of subjectivity involved in assessing the potential impact of future regulatory order on the financial statement management judgment include assessing the likelihood of recovery in future rate of incurred cost disallowance of part of the cost of recently completed plant or plant under construction and or refund to customer given that management accounting judgment are based on assumption about the outcome of future decision by the commission auditing these judgment required specialized knowledge of accounting for rate regulation and the rate setting process due to it inherent complexity and significant auditor judgment to evaluate management estimate and the subjectivity of audit evidence how the critical audit matter wa addressed in the auditour audit procedure related to the uncertainty of future decision by the commission included the following among others we tested the effectiveness of management control over the evaluation of the likelihood of the recovery in future rate of cost incurred property plant and equipment and deferred regulatory asset and refund or future reduction in rate that should be reported regulatory liability we also tested the effectiveness of management control over the initial recognition of amount property plant and equipment regulatory asset or liability and the monitoring and evaluation of regulatory development that may affect the likelihood of recovering cost in future rate or of future reduction in rate we read relevant regulatory order issued by the commission for alabama power regulatory statute interpretation procedural memorandum filing made by intervenor and other publicly available information to ass the likelihood of recovery in future rate or of future reduction in rate based on precedent of the commission treatment of similar cost under similar circumstance we evaluated the external information and compared it to management recorded regulatory asset and liability balance for completeness for regulatory matter in process we inspected filing with the commission by alabama power and other interested party that may impact alabama power future rate for any evidence that might contradict management assertion we evaluated regulatory filing for any evidence that intervenor are challenging full recovery of the cost of any capital project we tested selected cost included in the capitalized project cost for completeness and accuracy we obtained representation from management regarding probability of recovery for regulatory asset or refund or disclosure of uncertainty plant vogtle unit and construction refer to note regulatory matter georgia power nuclear construction to the financial statementscritical audit matter descriptionas discussed in note to the financial statement the ultimate recovery of georgia power company georgia power investment in the construction of plant vogtle unit and is subject to multiple uncertainty such uncertainty include the potential impact of future decision by georgia power regulator particularly the georgia public service commission action by the co owner of the vogtle project and litigation or other legal proceeding involving the project in addition georgia power ability to meet it cost and schedule forecast could impact it capacity to fully recover it investment in the project while the project is not subject to cost cap georgia power cost and schedule forecast are subject to numerous uncertainty which could impact cost recovery including challenge with management of contractor and vendor subcontractor performance supervision of craft labor and related craft labor productivity particularly in the installation of electrical mechanical and instrumentation and control commodity ability to attract and retain craft labor and or related cost escalation procurement fabrication delivery assembly installation system turnover and the initial testing and start up including any required engineering change or any remediation related thereto of plant system structure or component some of which are based on new technology that only within the last few year began initial operation in the global nuclear industry at this scale any of which may require additional labor and or material or other issue that could arise and change the projected schedule and estimated cost in addition the continuing effect of the covid pandemic could further disrupt or delay construction testing supervisory and support activity at plant vogtle unit and the ultimate recovery of georgia power investment in plant ii table of content index to financial statementsvogtle unit and is subject to the outcome of future assessment by management well georgia public service commission decision in future regulatory proceeding management ha recorded charge to income including total of million in when it ha determined that it is likely to incur cost for which it will not seek recovery or which it can not conclude are probable of recovery through the ratemaking process in addition management ha disclosed the status risk and uncertainty associated with plant vogtle unit and including the status of construction the status of regulatory proceeding the status of legal action or issue involving the co owner of the project and other matter which could impact the ultimate recoverability of georgia power investment in the project we identified critical audit matter the evaluation of georgia power identification and disclosure of event and uncertainty that could impact the ultimate cost recovery of it investment in the construction of plant vogtle unit and this critical audit matter involved significant audit effort requiring specialized industry and construction expertise extensive knowledge of rate regulation and difficult and subjective judgment how the critical audit matter wa addressed in the auditour audit procedure related to georgia power identification and disclosure of event and uncertainty that could impact the ultimate cost recovery of it investment in the construction of plant vogtle unit and included the following among others we tested the effectiveness of internal control over the on going evaluation monitoring and disclosure of matter related to the construction and ultimate cost recovery of plant vogtle unit and we involved construction specialist to assist in our evaluation of georgia power process for on going evaluation and monitoring of the construction schedule and to ass the disclosure of the uncertainty impacting the ultimate cost recovery of it investment in the construction of plant vogtle unit and we attended meeting with georgia power and southern company official project manager including contractor independent regulatory monitor and co owner of the project to evaluate and monitor construction status and identify cost and schedule challenge we read report of external independent monitor employed by the georgia public service commission to monitor the status of construction at plant vogtle unit and to evaluate the completeness of georgia power disclosure of the uncertainty impacting the ultimate cost recovery of it investment in the construction of plant vogtle unit and we inquired of georgia power and southern company official and project manager regarding the status of construction the construction schedule and cost forecast to ass the financial statement disclosure with respect to project status and potential risk and uncertainty to the achievement of such forecast we inspected regulatory filing and transcript of georgia public service commission hearing regarding the construction of plant vogtle unit and to identify potential challenge to the recovery of georgia power construction cost and to evaluate the disclosure with respect to such uncertainty we inquired of georgia power and southern company management and internal and external legal counsel regarding any potential legal action or issue arising from project construction or issue involving the co owner of the project we monitored the status of review by the nuclear regulatory commission to identify potential impediment to the licensing and commercial operation of the project we compared the financial statement disclosure relating to this matter to the information gathered through the conduct of all our procedure to evaluate whether there were omission relating to significant fact or uncertainty regarding the status of construction or other factor which could impact the ultimate cost recovery of plant vogtle unit and we obtained representation from management regarding disclosure of all matter related to the cost and or status of the construction of plant vogtle unit and including matter related to co owner or regulatory development that could impact the recovery of the related cost deloitte touche llpatlanta georgiafebruary have served georgia power auditor since ii table of content index to financial and to the financial statementscritical audit matter descriptionsouthern power ha entered into number of tax equity partnership arrangement wherein they agree to sell of class of membership interest class in an entity to noncontrolling investor in exchange for cash contribution while retaining control of the entity through separate class of membership interest class the agreement for these partnership give different right and priority to their owner in term of cash distribution tax attribute allocation and partnership income or loss allocation these provision make the conventional equity method of accounting where an investor applies it percentage ownership interest to the investee net income under generally accepted accounting principle to determine the investor share of earnings or loss difficult to apply therefore southern power us the hypothetical liquidation at book value hlbv accounting method to account for these partnership arrangement the hlbv accounting method calculates each partner share of income or loss based on the change in net equity the partner can legally claim at the end of the reporting period compared to the beginning of the reporting period the application of the hlbv accounting method by southern power required significant consideration of the allocation between southern power and the noncontrolling investor over the life of the agreement and the liquidation provision of the agreement to determine the appropriate allocation of income or loss between the party the determination of the appropriate amount of allocated partnership income or loss to noncontrolling interest using the hlbv accounting method required increased audit effort and specialized skill and knowledge including evaluation of the term of the agreement and consideration of the appropriateness of the hlbv model based on the provision of the agreement ii table of content index to financial statementshow the critical audit matter wa addressed in the auditour audit procedure included the following among others for agreement that result in potentially material allocation of partnership income or loss we read the agreement to understand the liquidation provision and the provision governing the allocation of benefit with the assistance of our income tax and hlbv modeling specialist we evaluated the hlbv model utilized by management to determine whether the model accurately reflect the allocation of income or loss and tax attribute in accordance with the liquidation provision and allocation term defined in the agreement well whether the input in the model are accurate and complete deloitte touche llpatlanta georgiafebruary have served southern power auditor since ii table of content index to financial statementsconsolidated liability and note regulatory matter southern company gas to the financial statementscritical audit matter descriptionsouthern company gas natural gas distribution utility the regulated utility subsidiary which represent approximately of southern company gas consolidated revenue are subject to rate regulation in georgia illinois tennessee and virginia by their respective state public service commission or other applicable state regulatory agency collectively the commission management ha determined it meet the requirement under accounting principle generally accepted in the united state of america to prepare it financial statement applying the specialized rule to account for the effect of regulation accounting for the economics of rate regulation impact multiple financial statement line item and disclosure including but not limited to ii table of content index to financial statementsproperty plant and equipment other regulatory asset other regulatory liability other cost of removal obligation deferred charge and credit related to income tax operating revenue other operation and maintenance expense and depreciation and amortization the commission set the rate the regulated utility subsidiary are permitted to charge customer rate are determined and approved in regulatory proceeding based on an analysis of the applicable regulated utility subsidiary cost to provide utility service and return on and recovery of it investment in the utility business current and future regulatory decision can have an impact on the recovery of cost the rate of return earned on investment and the timing and amount of asset to be recovered by rate the commission regulation of rate is premised on the full recovery of prudently incurred cost and reasonable rate of return on invested capital while southern company gas regulated utility subsidiary expect to recover cost from customer through regulated rate there is risk that the commission will not approve full recovery of the cost of providing utility service or full recovery of all amount invested in the utility business and reasonable return on that investment we identified the impact of rate regulation critical audit matter due to the significant judgment made by management to support it assertion about impacted account balance and disclosure and the high degree of subjectivity involved in assessing the impact of future regulatory order on the financial statement management judgment include assessing the likelihood of recovery in future rate of incurred cost disallowance of part of the cost of recently completed plant or plant under construction and or refund to customer given that management accounting judgment are based on assumption about the outcome of future decision by the commission auditing these judgment required specialized knowledge of accounting for rate regulation and the rate setting process due to it inherent complexity and significant auditor judgment to evaluate management estimate and the subjectivity of audit evidence how the critical audit matter wa addressed in the auditour audit procedure related to the uncertainty of future decision by the commission included the following among others we tested the effectiveness of management control over the evaluation of the likelihood of the recovery in future rate of cost incurred property plant and equipment and deferred regulatory asset and refund or future reduction in rate that should be reported regulatory liability we also tested the effectiveness of management control over the initial recognition of amount property plant and equipment regulatory asset or liability and the monitoring and evaluation of regulatory development that may affect the likelihood of recovering cost in future rate or of future reduction in rate we read relevant regulatory order issued by the commission for southern company gas regulated utility subsidiary in georgia illinois tennessee and virginia regulatory statute interpretation procedural memorandum filing made by intervenor and other publicly available information to ass the likelihood of recovery in future rate or of future reduction in rate based on precedent of the commission treatment of similar cost under similar circumstance we evaluated the external information and compared it to management recorded regulatory asset and liability balance for completeness for regulatory matter in process we inspected filing with the commission by the regulated utility subsidiary and other interested party that may impact the regulated utility subsidiary future rate for any evidence that might contradict management assertion we evaluated regulatory filing for any evidence that intervenor are challenging full recovery of the cost of any capital project we tested selected cost included in the capitalized project cost for completeness and accuracy we obtained representation from management regarding probability of recovery for regulatory asset or refund or future reduction in rate for regulatory liability to ass management assertion that amount are probable of recovery or future reduction in rate we evaluated southern company gas disclosure related to the impact of rate regulation including the balance recorded and regulatory development derivative refer to note summary of significant accounting policy and note derivative to the financial statementscritical audit matter description southern company gas is exposed to market risk including commodity price risk interest rate risk weather risk and occasionally foreign currency exchange rate risk and enters into contract to manage the volatility attributable to these exposure the majority of these contract are over the counter wholesale contract for the purchase or sale of natural gas or consist of contract which do not include asset management agreement financial optionality or potential embedded derivative typically these physical and financial contract are not complex in structure and the valuation input are directly obtained from an observable source however determining whether contract meet the definition of derivative instrument contains an embedded derivative requiring bifurcation or qualifies for hedge accounting treatment is complex and requires significant ii table of content index to financial statementsjudgment in addition the treatment of single contract may vary from period to period depending upon accounting election change in southern company gas assessment of the likelihood of future hedged transaction or new interpretation of accounting guidance result judgment is required in determining the appropriate accounting each period accounting for derivative impact multiple financial statement line item and disclosure such asset and liability from risk management activity other deferred charge and asset other deferred credit and liability natural gas revenue and cost of natural gas we identified the evaluation and monitoring of contract with more complex term critical audit matter and specifically whether these type of contract meet the definition of derivative instrument contain an embedded derivative requiring bifurcation or qualify for hedge accounting treatment auditing these contract is especially challenging due to the complexity of the accounting requirement requiring the specialized knowledge of such accounting how the critical audit matter wa addressed in the auditwith the assistance of our energy transacting specialist our audit procedure related to these contract included the following among others we tested the effectiveness of management control over approval and assessment of contract and contract amendment that require additional level of management review to ass deal on frequent basis and to evaluate contract meeting southern company gas criterion by accounting and the appropriate level of management for proper classification between derivative or accrual accounting we tested on sample basis contract and contract amendment derivative and non derivative with focus on those with more complex term by independently evaluating the accounting treatment and comparing to the conclusion reached by management we evaluated southern company gas disclosure related to derivative for completeness and accuracy based on the result of our audit procedure and the accounting assumption had significant effect on the postretirement benefit obligation calculation ii table of content index to financial statementsthe primary procedure we performed to address this critical annual summary of significant accounting policiesgeneralsouthern company is the parent company of three traditional electric operating company well southern power southern company gas sc southern linc southern holding southern nuclear powersecure and other direct and indirect subsidiary the traditional electric operating company alabama power georgia power and mississippi power are vertically integrated utility providing electric service in three southeastern state in january southern company completed the sale of gulf power another traditional electric operating company through december to nextera energy southern power develops construct acquires owns and manages power generation asset including renewable energy and battery energy storage project and sell electricity at market based rate in the wholesale market southern company gas distributes natural gas through natural gas distribution utility including nicor gas illinois atlanta gas light georgia virginia natural gas and chattanooga gas tennessee in southern company gas sold it other natural gas utility elizabethtown gas new jersey florida city gas and elkton gas maryland southern company gas is also involved in several other complementary business including gas pipeline investment wholesale gas service and gas marketing service sc the system service company provides at cost specialized service to southern company and it subsidiary company southern linc provides digital wireless communication for use by southern company and it subsidiary company and also market these service to the public and provides fiber optic service within the southeast southern holding is an intermediate holding company subsidiary primarily for southern company leveraged lease and other investment southern nuclear operates and provides service to the southern company system nuclear power plant including alabama power plant farley and georgia power plant hatch and plant vogtle unit and and is currently managing construction and start up of plant vogtle unit and which are co owned by georgia power powersecure provides energy solution to electric utility and their customer in the area of distributed generation energy storage and renewables and energy efficiency see note for information regarding disposition activity including southern company sale of gulf power the registrant financial statement reflect investment in subsidiary on consolidated basis intercompany transaction have been eliminated in consolidation the equity method is used for investment in entity in which registrant ha significant influence but doe not have control and for vies where registrant ha an equity investment but is not the primary beneficiary southern power ha controlling ownership in certain legal entity for which the contractual provision represent profit sharing arrangement because the allocation of cash distribution and tax benefit are not based on fixed ownership percentage for these arrangement the noncontrolling interest is accounted for under balance sheet approach utilizing the hlbv method the hlbv method calculates each partner share of income based on the change in net equity the partner can legally claim in hlbv at the end of the period compared to the beginning of the period see variable interest entity herein and note for additional information the traditional electric operating traditional electric operating company and the natural gas distribution utility are subject to accounting requirement for the effect of rate regulation regulatory asset represent probable future revenue associated with certain cost that are expected to be recovered from customer through the ratemaking process regulatory liability represent cost recovered that are expected to be incurred in the future or probable future reduction in revenue associated with amount that are expected to be credited to customer through the ratemaking process in the event that portion of traditional electric operating company or natural gas distribution utility operation is no longer subject to applicable accounting rule for rate regulation such company would be required to write off to income or reclassify to aoci related regulatory asset and liability that are not specifically recoverable through regulated rate in addition the traditional electric operating company or the natural gas distribution utility would be required to determine if any impairment to other asset including plant exists and write down the asset if impaired to their fair value all regulatory asset and liability are to be reflected in rate see note for additional information including detail of regulatory asset and liability reflected in the balance sheet for southern company the traditional electric operating company and southern company gas revenuesthe registrant generate revenue from variety of source which are accounted for under various revenue accounting guidance including revenue from contract with customer lease derivative and regulatory accounting see note and for additional information traditional electric operating companiesthe majority of the revenue of the traditional electric operating company are generated from contract with retail electric customer these revenue generated from the integrated service to deliver electricity when and if called upon by the customer are recognized single performance obligation satisfied over time at tariff rate and electricity is delivered to the customer during the month unbilled revenue related to retail sale are accrued at the end of each fiscal period retail rate may include provision to adjust revenue for fluctuation in fuel cost fuel hedging the energy component of purchased power cost and certain other cost revenue are adjusted for difference between these actual cost and amount billed in current regulated rate under or over recovered regulatory clause revenue are recorded in the balance sheet and are recovered from or returned to customer respectively through adjustment to the billing factor see note for additional information regarding regulatory matter of the traditional electric operating company wholesale capacity revenue from ppas are recognized in amount billable under the contract term energy and other revenue are generally recognized service are provided the contract for capacity and energy in wholesale ppa have multiple performance obligation where the contract total transaction price is allocated to each performance obligation based on the standalone selling price the standalone selling price is primarily determined by the price charged to customer for the specific good or service transferred with the performance obligation generally the traditional electric operating company recognize revenue the performance obligation are satisfied over time electricity is delivered to the customer or generation capacity is available to the customer for both retail and wholesale revenue the traditional electric operating company have elected to recognize revenue for their sale of electricity and capacity using the invoice practical expedient they generally have right to consideration in an amount that corresponds directly with the value to the customer of the performance completed to date and that may be invoiced payment for good and service rendered is typically due in the subsequent month following satisfaction of the registrant performance obligation southern powersouthern power sell capacity and energy at rate specified under contractual term in long term ppas these ppas are accounted for operating lease non derivative or normal sale derivative capacity revenue from ppas classified operating lease ii table of content index to financial statementscombined note to rather than traditional utility sell natural gas to end use customer in georgia and handle customer billing function required by the georgia psc atlanta gas light bill marketer in equal monthly installment for each residential commercial and industrial end use customer distribution cost well for capacity cost utilizing seasonal rate design for the calculation of each residential end use customer annual straight fixed variable charge which reflects the historic volumetric usage pattern for the entire residential class the majority of the revenue of southern company gas are generated over time and are recognized at tariff rate gas is delivered to the customer during the month the standalone selling price is primarily determined by the price charged to customer for the specific customer the performance obligation related to wholesale gas service are satisfied and revenue is recognized at point in time when natural gas is delivered to the customer southern company gas ha elected to recognize revenue for sale of gas using the invoice practical expedient it generally ha right to consideration in an amount that corresponds directly with the value to the customer of the performance completed to date and that may be invoiced payment for good and service rendered is typically due in the subsequent month following satisfaction of southern company gas performance obligation with the exception of atlanta gas light the natural gas distribution utility have rate structure that include volumetric rate design that allow the opportunity to recover certain cost based on gas usage revenue from sale and transportation service are recognized in the same period in which the related volume are delivered to customer revenue from residential and certain commercial and industrial customer are recognized on the basis of scheduled meter reading additionally unbilled revenue are recognized for estimated delivery of gas not yet billed to these customer from the last bill date to the end of the accounting period for other commercial and industrial customer and for all wholesale customer revenue are based on actual delivery through the end of the period the tariff for several of the natural gas distribution utility include provision which allow for the recognition of certain revenue prior to the time such revenue are billed to customer these provision are acquisition accounting for transportation contract at southern company gas were fully amortized of december acquisition accountingat the time of an acquisition management will ass whether acquired asset and activity meet the definition of business for acquisition that meet the definition of business operating result from the date of acquisition are included in the acquiring entity financial statement the purchase price including any contingent consideration is allocated based on the fair value of the identifiable asset acquired and liability assumed including any intangible asset asset acquired that do not meet the definition of business are accounted for an asset acquisition the purchase price of each asset acquisition is allocated based on the relative fair value of asset acquired determining the fair value of asset acquired and liability assumed requires management judgment and management may engage independent valuation expert to assist in this process fair value are determined by using market participant assumption and typically include the timing and amount of future cash flow incurred construction cost the nature of acquired contract discount rate power market price and expected asset life any due diligence or transition cost incurred for potential or successful acquisition are expensed incurred historically contingent consideration primarily relates to fixed amount due to the seller once an acquired construction project is placed in service for contingent consideration with variable payment management fair value the arrangement with any change recorded in the statement of income see note for additional fair value information development costsfor southern power development cost are capitalized once project is probable of completion primarily based on review of it economics and operational feasibility well the status of power off take agreement and regulatory approval if applicable southern power capitalized development cost are included in cwip on the balance sheet all of southern power development cost incurred prior to the determination that project is probable of completion are expensed incurred and included in other operation and maintenance expense in the statement of income if it is determined that project is no longer probable of completion any of southern power capitalized development cost are expensed and included in distribution utility record natural gas inventory on wacog basis in georgia deregulated competitive environment marketer sell natural gas to firm end use customer at market based price on monthly basis atlanta gas light assigns to marketer the majority of the pipeline storage service that it ha under contract along with corresponding amount of inventory atlanta gas light retains and manages portion of it pipeline storage asset and related natural gas inventory for system balancing and to serve system demand nicor gas natural gas inventory is carried at cost on lifo basis inventory decrement occurring during the year that are restored prior to year end are charged to cost of natural gas at the estimated annual replacement cost inventory decrement that are not restored prior to year end are charged to cost of natural gas at the actual lifo cost of the inventory layer liquidated the cost of natural gas including inventory cost is recovered from customer under purchased gas recovery mechanism adjusted for difference between actual cost and amount billed therefore lifo liquidation have no impact on southern company or southern company gas net income at december the nicor gas lifo inventory balance wa million based on the average cost of gas purchased in december the estimated replacement cost of nicor gas inventory at december wa million ii table of content index to under such circumstance southern company gas wholesale gas service would need to post collateral to continue transacting business with some of it counterparties of december and the required collateral in the event of credit rating downgrade wa million and million respectively southern company gas wholesale gas service us established credit policy to determine and monitor the creditworthiness of counterparties including requirement to post collateral or other credit security well the quality of pledged collateral collateral or credit security is most often in the form of cash or letter of credit from an investment grade financial institution but may also include cash or government security held by trustee when more than one derivative transaction with the same counterparty is outstanding and legally enforceable netting agreement exists with that counterparty the net mark to market exposure represents reasonable measure of southern company gas credit risk with that counterparty southern company gas wholesale gas service also us other netting agreement with certain counterparties with it conduct significant transaction see concentration of credit risk herein for additional information provision for uncollectible accountsthe customer of the traditional electric operating company and the natural gas distribution utility are billed monthly for the majority of receivables provision for uncollectible account is established based on historical collection experience and other factor for the remaining receivables if the company is aware of specific customer inability to pay provision for uncollectible account is recorded to reduce the receivable balance to the amount reasonably expected to be collected if circumstance change the estimate of the recoverability of account receivable could change well circumstance that could affect this estimate include but are not limited to customer credit issue customer deposit and general economic condition customer account are written off once they are deemed to be uncollectible for all period presented uncollectible account averaged le than of revenue for each registrant credit risk exposure at nicor gas is mitigated by bad debt rider approved by the illinois commission the bad debt rider provides for the recovery from or refund to customer of the difference between nicor gas actual bad debt experience on an annual basis and the benchmark bad debt expense used to establish it base rate for the respective year see note for information regarding recovery of incremental bad debt expense southern power use derivative financial instrument to limit exposure to fluctuation in interest rate the price of certain fuel purchase electricity purchase and sale and occasionally foreign currency exchange rate southern company gas us derivative financial instrument to limit exposure to fluctuation in natural gas price weather interest rate and commodity price all derivative financial instrument are recognized either asset or liability on the balance sheet included in other or shown separately risk management activity and are measured at fair value see note for additional information regarding fair value substantially all of the traditional electric operating company and southern power bulk energy purchase and sale contract that meet the definition of derivative are excluded from fair value accounting requirement because they qualify for the normal scope exception and are accounted for under the ii table of content index to financial statementscombined note to financial statement continued southern company and subsidiary company annual reportaccrual method derivative contract that qualify cash flow hedge of anticipated transaction or are recoverable through the traditional electric operating company and the natural gas distribution utility fuel hedging program result in the deferral of related gain and loss in aoci or regulatory asset and liability respectively until the hedged transaction occur other derivative contract that qualify fair value hedge are marked to market through current period income and are recorded on net basis in the statement of income cash flow from derivative are classified on the statement of cash flow in the same category the hedged item see note for additional information regarding derivative the registrant offset fair value amount recognized for multiple derivative instrument executed with the same counterparty under netting arrangement the registrant had no outstanding collateral repayment obligation or right to reclaim collateral arising from derivative instrument recognized at december the registrant are exposed to potential loss related to financial instrument in the event of counterparties nonperformance the registrant have established risk management policy and control to determine and monitor the creditworthiness of counterparties in order to mitigate their exposure to counterparty credit risk southern company gassouthern company gas enters into weather derivative contract economic hedge of natural gas revenue in the event of warmer than normal weather in the heating season exchange traded option are carried at fair value with change reflected in natural gas revenue non exchange traded option are accounted for using the intrinsic value method change in the intrinsic value for non exchange traded contract are also reflected in natural gas revenue in the statement of income wholesale gas service purchase natural gas for storage when the current market price paid to buy and transport natural gas plus the cost to store and finance the natural gas is le than the market price that can be received in the future resulting in positive net natural gas revenue nymex future and otc contract are used to sell natural gas at that future price to substantially protect the natural gas revenue that will ultimately be realized when the stored natural gas is sold southern company gas enters into transaction to secure transportation capacity between delivery point in order to serve it customer and various market nymex future and otc contract are used to capture the price differential or spread between the location served by the capacity in order to substantially protect the natural gas revenue that will ultimately be realized when the physical flow of natural gas between delivery point occurs these contract generally meet the definition of derivative and are carried at fair value on the balance sheet with change in fair value recorded in natural gas revenue on the statement of income in the period of change these contract are not designated hedge for accounting purpose the purchase transportation storage and sale of natural gas are accounted for on weighted average cost or accrual basis appropriate rather than on the fair value basis utilized for the derivative used to mitigate the natural gas price risk associated with the storage and transportation portfolio monthly demand charge are incurred for the contracted storage and transportation capacity and payment associated with asset management agreement and these demand charge and payment are recognized on the statement of income in the period they are incurred this difference in accounting method can result in volatility in reported earnings even though the economic margin is substantially unchanged from the date the transaction were consummated comprehensive incomethe objective of comprehensive income is to report measure of all change in common stock equity of an enterprise that result from transaction and other economic event of the period other than transaction with owner comprehensive income consists of net income attributable to the registrant change in the fair value of qualifying cash flow hedge and reclassification for amount included in net income comprehensive income also consists of certain change in pension and other postretirement benefit alabama power maintains reserve for operation and maintenance expense to cover the cost of damage from major storm to it transmission and distribution facility the order approves separate monthly rate ndr charge to customer consisting of two component the first component is intended to establish and maintain reserve balance for future storm and is an on going part of customer billing when the reserve balance fall below million reserve establishment charge will be activated and the on going reserve maintenance charge concurrently suspended until the reserve balance reach million the second component of the rate ndr charge is intended to allow recovery of any existing deferred storm related operation and maintenance cost and any future reserve deficit over month period the alabama psc order give alabama power authority to record deficit balance in the ndr when cost of storm damage exceed any established reserve balance absent further alabama psc approval the maximum total rate ndr charge consisting of both component is per month per non residential customer account and per month per residential customer account alabama power ha the authority based on an order from the alabama psc to accrue certain additional amount circumstance warrant the order allows for reliability related expenditure to be charged against the additional accrual when the ndr balance exceeds million alabama power may designate portion of the ndr to reliability related expenditure part of an annual budget process for the following year or during the current year for identified unbudgeted reliability related expenditure that are incurred accrual that have not been designated can be used to offset storm charge additional accrual to the ndr enhance alabama power ability to mitigate the financial effect of future natural disaster promote system reliability and offset cost retail customer would otherwise bear alabama power made additional accrual of million and million in and respectively there were no such accrual in discussed herein under tax reform accounting order in accordance with an alabama psc order issued in december alabama power also applied the remaining excess of the remaining workforce and reducing workforce fatigue and absenteeism further it wa also intended to allow for increased social distancing by the workforce and facilitate compliance with the recognition that mississippi power long term financial success is dependent upon how well it satisfies it customer need pep includes performance indicator that directly tie customer service indicator to mississippi power allowed roe pep measure mississippi power performance on point scale weighted average of result in three area average customer price compared to price of other regional utility weighted at service reliability measured in percentage of time customer had electric service and customer satisfaction measured in survey of residential customer typically two pep filing are made for each calendar year the pep projected filing and the pep lookback filing on july the mississippi psc approved mississippi power revision to the pep compliance rate clause agreed to in the mississippi power rate case settlement agreement these revision include among other thing changing the filing date for the annual pep rate projected filing from november of the immediately preceding year to march of the current year utilizing historic test year adjusted for known and measurable change using discounted cash flow and regression formula to determine base roe and moving all embedded ad valorem property tax currently collected in pep to the ad valorem tax adjustment clause the pep lookback filing will continue to be filed after the end of the year and allows for review of the actual revenue requirement in mississippi power revised it annual projected pep filing for to reflect the impact of the tax reform legislation the revised filing requested an increase of million in annual revenue jurisdiction the cost of repairing actual damage resulting from such event that individually exceed is charged to the reserve every three year the mississippi psc the mpus and mississippi power agree on srr revenue level for the ensuing period based on historical data expected exposure type and amount of insurance coverage excluding insurance cost and any other relevant information the accrual amount and the reserve balance are determined based on the srr revenue level if significant change in circumstance occurs then the srr revenue level can be adjusted more frequently if mississippi power the mpus and the mississippi psc deem the change appropriate the property damage reserve accrual will be the difference between the approved srr revenue and the srr revenue requirement in company gasutility regulation and rate designthe natural gas distribution utility are subject to regulation and oversight by their respective state regulatory agency rate charged to customer vary according to customer class residential commercial or industrial and rate jurisdiction these agency approve rate designed to provide the opportunity to generate revenue to recover all prudently incurred cost including return on rate base sufficient to pay interest on debt and provide reasonable roe result of operating in deregulated environment atlanta gas light earns revenue by charging rate to it customer based primarily on monthly fixed charge that are set by the georgia psc and adjusted periodically the marketer add these fixed charge when billing customer this mechanism called straight fixed variable rate design minimizes the seasonality of atlanta gas light revenue since the monthly fixed charge is not volumetric or directly weather dependent with the exception of atlanta gas light the earnings of the natural gas distribution utility can be affected by customer consumption pattern that are largely function of weather condition and price level for natural gas specifically customer demand substantially increase during the heating season when natural gas is used for heating purpose southern company gas ha various mechanism such weather and revenue normalization mechanism and weather derivative instrument that limit exposure to weather change within typical range in these utility respective service territory ii table of content index to in the case pending mediation in the third quarter the party reached settlement and the plaintiff filed stipulation of settlement and motion for preliminary approval to resolve the case on class wide
